body.name: Dyson Purifier Big+Quiet Formaldehyde BP03 Extra Large
body.merchantInfo: Sold by Amazon Warehouse and Fulfilled by Amazon.
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Wednesday, February 21. Order within 17 hrs 52 mins
features: Large format purifier with HEPA H13 grade filtration.
Projects air over 32 feet and purifies large spaces.¹
Control and monitor your air quality from anywhere using the MyDyson app.⁵
HEPA H13⁴ grade filter is 3.8x larger than previous generation and lasts up to 5 years.
Breeze mode recreates the feeling of natural air indoors.
Program your machine to turn off after preset intervals, between 30 minutes and 8 hours.
Do not disturb mode monitors and purifies using the quietest settings, with a dimmed display.
body.description: The Dyson Purifier Big+Quiet Formaldehyde is our biggest purifier yet, engineered from the ground up, to evenly purify large spaces.¹ Cone aerodynamics creates a condensed jet of air to project purified air over 32 feet. Quietly. An advanced 360 HEPA H13 grade filter captures allergens and 99.97% of fine particles. Removes gases and odors.² Destroys formaldehyde, permanently.³¹Testing for PM2.5 purification completed in a large testing chamber following relevant Dyson testing methods. Results may vary in practice.²Tested to JEM 1467 (acetic acid, acetaldehyde, ammonia), GB/T18801 (formaldehyde, benzene) and DTM-003282 (NO2). Gas capture rates vary.³Third party full machine testing based on GB/T 18801-2022 formaldehyde cumulative clean mass testing with continuous injection until plateau of formaldehyde CADR is achieved. Results may vary in practice.⁴Particle challenge by DEHS oil specified in EN1822 within a chamber specified in ASTM F3150. Tested in Max Mode for whole machine efficiency above 99.95%.⁵Requires device to run app, Wi-Fi or mobile data, Bluetooth 4.0 support, and iOS version 10 or Android version 5 (or above). Standard data and messaging rates may apply.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Quiet, even at full power Acoustically engineered to operate quietly – even at its highest power setting.

Advanced 360° filtration system Captures 99.97% of fine particles as small as 0.1 microns. Removes gases and odors.² Destroys formaldehyde, permanently³ A catalytic filter continuously traps and breaks down formaldehyde molecules into water and CO2. And it never needs replacing. Fully sealed to HEPA H13 standard⁴ To prevent pollutants leaking back into the air, it’s not just the filter that’s sealed to HEPA H13 standard, it’s the whole purifier.⁴

Long-range projection and circulation An energy-efficient system which projects air over 32 feet and purifies large spaces,¹ quietly. Adjust your airflow Adjust the angle of airflow at 0°, 25° or 50°, or mimic the feeling of refreshing air indoors using Breeze mode.

Control your air quality wherever you are The MyDyson app gives you autonomy over your air quality. View which particles have been captured, set schedules, browse reports, and more.⁵ Auto-mode With the auto-mode feature, your purifier can sense, capture and report on pollutants in your home in real time.

Discreet wheels Easily maneuver your machine across a room designed for hard surfaces, the wheels are hidden from view. Hygienic filter replacement A hygienic replacement mechanism allows you to dispose of the HEPA filter in one click.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars It is big, it is quiet. No obvious flaws.
reviews.reviewText: I've got Coway Airmega AP-1512HH, Mila Air Purifier, BISSELL air320, BLUEAIR Blue Pure 411, and now a Dyson Big+Quiet. -- Yes, too many.BISSELL fan is annoyingly loud with a tiny rattle to it. Dislike it, put it in garage.BLUAIR is just tiny and when fan spins up is loud... you gotta have a tiny room for it to make sense, I guess.. Coway is just so much better in every way.Mila is fine, I have it in an office. Filters seem expensive for size, but the auto fan control works well.. 90% of time its totally silent. If someone burns something in kitchen its quick to ramp fan and gets a bit loud, but that's what you want, to get air clean and ASAP and it then gets silent again. It'd be great if not so pricey.Coway seems best value for money. Fan moves a lot of air for how quiet it is. Filters are cheap enough. Its very quiet on low speeds, does get loud at max fan but it moves a lot of air. Only has like blue/green/red light doesn't give exact numbers for particulate.. only downside, but its so cheap can't complain. Auto fan control works. Its just hard to beat the Coway the value is so high.But then we've moved into a new house with a big open floor plan and 12ft ceilings.. its just a big area. None of others really handle that much space, so got a Big+Quiet. And no regrets.- It is big, so normal rooms probably silly large. But in big enough room it doesn't look out-of-place. And IMO it generally looks good.- With fan at 10/10 its quieter than Coway/Mila at max fan while moving more air. With fan at 5 its quiet, but audible if room is otherwise silent. But if couple people are in room doing anything they'll be making too much noise to hear it at 5/10. When fan is on auto and drops down to 1-2 its really hard to hear even in a silent room.- The app works fine. Remote works. I prefer app.- The wheels are nice. Not that you'll move it often, but when you do it glides effortlessly. We've been testing out how it looks in different places and wife rolls it around and doesn't ask me to move it for her. Longterm probably won't move it often, but still nice feature.- I like how long the filters claim to work. Don't mind paying a lot for filter if it'll last awhile. Mila for example has a $59-99 filter they want you to replace every 6 months, its just crazy expensive. Dyson says up to 5 years for $170 filter.And I really nothing to complain about. If you have large area this is air purifier to get.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Large and quiet air purifier
reviews.reviewText: I was skeptical and hesitant to purchase this unit because of the steep price tag. But it turned out to be one of the best online purchases I’ve made. It is powerful yet very quiet. The air quality sensors are quite accurate. It detects changes in the air when my wife cooks and self adjusts the speed accordingly. It works well in a large room (mine is ~1500sqft) and I could feel the breeze 20+ ft away. Setting up was easy and with the MyDyson app you can view different parameters including Air Quality, PM2.5, PM10, VOC, NO2, formaldehyde, Humidity and Temp. Highly recommend it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Almost perfect but definitely the best air purifier I have used.
reviews.reviewText: This is, without a doubt, the best air purifier I have used. There are a few things I'd like to see changed, added and improved but I still think that it was very much worth it. Addressing some of the positives first:- I personally love the modern and classic Dyson design and styling. This is very much subjective but I'm a big fan even though it may strike some people as a very sleek trashcan.- Build quality is fantastic and all components of the design are clearly well thought out and addressed. It has wheels making it easy to maneuver around the house and to adjust directions.- LCD display is easy to read and intuitive.- Air purification has so far been fantastic. I don't have the means to measure it precisely, but I have air purifiers in rooms directly adjacent to the living room where the Dyson is situated and since using the Dyson my air quality readings on the other purifiers shows a drastic improvement in air quality.- In addition to what I mentioned above, the effective area of this purifier is fantastic. It easily covers my entire living room. From a pure performance standpoint, this is an excellent purifier and is the main reason why I am so happy with it. Filters are affordable and long lasting.Now to address some of the negatives and other observations:- No smart home integration which seems like a big minus here, even though it is not advertised as such. There is no remote/smartphone control at all which I find very surprising. It would be great to set it to a schedule or have it adjust based on air quality. However, I wouldn't be surprised if this could be addressed via a firmware update if the hardware is capable of doing so but that is purely speculative.- Air quality reading is limited to Co2 only and there are only two power levels. It would be nice to have more data available and have more fine tuning abilities.Besides those few things, I still think this air purifier has made a great addition to my household. The wide area of coverage and filter lifespans make this a superior air purifier. Even though it is a significant investment, it is worthwhile if you are serious about a top performing air purifier.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Does a great job!
reviews.reviewText: It is exactly as quiet as they say. I love it! I have had other purifiers and this one is definitely at the top. Runs quietly until something is in the air. It’s very sensitive and I think that’s why I love it the most. It picks up on everything. Pricey but worth the money!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 24, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Dyson Air purifier
reviews.reviewText: Very quiet and works as it should. Great product. Quickly removes harmful particles and clears food and smoke smells quickly.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 7, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Amazing air purifier.
reviews.reviewText: Amazing air purifier, removes dust and pollutants. The fan control is manual or AUTO, the Dyson unit senses higher levels of pollutants and automatically adjusts the fan control. I noticed far less dust and smell of any kind. Even a slight spray of perfume is picked up and removed from the air, amazing.
